oiltank
Class OilTank

java.lang.Object
  oiltank.OilTank

public class OilTank
extends java.lang.Object

A class of tanks for storing oil, involving a capacity and a content.

Version:
2.0
Author:
Eric Steegmans

Constructor Summary

          Initialize this new oil tank with a capacity of 5000 and no contents.

Method Detail

getCapacity

@Raw
public int getCapacity()
Return the capacity of this oil tank. The capacity expresses the maximum amount of oil that can be stored in this oil tank.

isValidCapacity

public static boolean isValidCapacity(int capacity)
Check whether the given capacity is a valid capacity for any oil tank.

Parameters:
capacity - The capacity to check.
Returns:
True if the given capacity is positive; false otherwise. | result == (capacity > 0)

getContents

@Raw
public int getContents()
Return the contents of this oil tank. The contents expresses the actual amount of oil stored in this oil tank.

isValidContents

public static boolean isValidContents(int contents,
                                      int capacity)
Check whether the given contents is a valid contents for any oil tank under the given capacity.

Parameters:
contents - The contents to check.
capacity - The capacity to check the contents against.
Returns:
True if the given contents is not negative and does not exceed the given capacity; false otherwise. | result == | (contents >= 0) && (contents <= capacity)

getFree

public int getFree()
Return the free space of this oil tank. The free space is the maximum amount of oil that can still be added to this oil tank.

Returns:
The difference between the capacity of this oil tank and its contents. | result == getCapacity() - getContents()

isFull

public boolean isFull()
Check whether this oil tank is completely filled with oil.

Returns:
True if the free space in this oil tank is 0; false otherwise. | result == (getFree() == 0)

isEmpty

public boolean isEmpty()
Check whether this oil tank is empty.

Returns:
True if the contents of this oil tank is 0; false otherwise. | result == (getContents() == 0)

getPercentageFilled

public float getPercentageFilled()
Return the percentage of the capacity of this oil tank is currently filled with oil.

Returns:
The contents of this oil tank divided by its capacity, returned as a percentage. | result == (100.0F * getContents()) / getCapacity()

isRelativelyFullerThan

public boolean isRelativelyFullerThan(OilTank other)
Check whether this oil tank is relatively more filled than the other oil tank.

Parameters:
other - The oil tank to compare with.
Returns:
True if the filled percentage of this oil tank exceeds the filled percentage of the other oil tank; false otherwise. | result == | this.getPercentageFilled() > other.getPercentageFilled()

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
Return a textual representation of this oil tank.

Overrides:
toString in class java.lang.Object
Returns:
An effective string of the following form "Oil tank with capacity xxx and contents yyy". | result.equals | ("Oil tank with capacity " + getCapacity() + | " and contents " + getContents())

isSameAs

public boolean isSameAs(OilTank other)
Check whether this oil tank is identical to the other oil tank.

Parameters:
other - The other oil tank to compare with.
Returns:
True if the capacity and the contents of this oil tank are equal to the capacity, respectively the contents of the other oil tank. | result == | (getCapacity() == other.getCapacity()) && | (getContents() == other.getContents())

getCopy

public OilTank getCopy()
Return a new oil tank as an exact copy of this oil tank.

Returns:
A new effective oil tank, whose capacity and contents are identical to the capacity and the contents of this oil tank. | (result != null) && (result != this) && | result.isSameAs(this)
